caption.text:
A pair of golden earrings made in the Byzantine Empire in the seventh century, now in the V&A, London. Each earring is formed of a crescent-shaped panel pierced and cut to form foliate and figurative designs, to which have been soldered nine golden balls and a large golden hoop. The central motif is that of two birds drinking from a vase – a popular image in late antique and early Byzantine contexts in a range of media – which may have apotropaic connotations.﻿⠀
